intro: Languas stenosiphon, commonly known as the narrow-siphon plant, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with a distinctive siphon-like structure at the base of the petals. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
